metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0041 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In binder_transaction of binder.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-145988638References: Upstream kernel

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-lowlatency - 5.4.0-18.22
No subscription required
